prs.title: feat: add crosschain bitcoin redeemer contracts
prs.truncated_body:
## Add Cross-Chain Bitcoin Redeemer Contracts

### Description

This PR introduces a cross-chain Bitcoin redemption mechanism that enables users on L2/sidechain networks to redeem their tBTC tokens directly for Bitcoin without needing to bridge back to L1 first.

### Key Components

#### 1. **AbstractBTCRedeemer** (`contracts/integrator/AbstractBTCRedeemer.sol`)
- Abstract base contract t

prs.title: Include the token interface in the stellar asset interface
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Include the token interface in the stellar asset interface, and therefore also in the client.

### Why
The separation of the token functions from the stellar asset interface and client was originally done to ensure that developers didn't use the stellar asset client in situations where they really should be using the token client, to interface with tokens of any kind.

However, most

commits.message: Include token interface in stellar asset interface
rename stellar asset test variables for clarity

prs.title: Rename RestoredKeys => RestoredEntries
prs.truncated_body:
This is mostly just a rename of `RestoredKeys` to `RestoredEntries` -- this struct has been full entry maps (which are semantically meaningful!) for quite a while, they just didn't get renamed when they got expanded to this form. The current name is now somewhat misleading when thinking about data consistency scenarios.

There are also a couple small comment additions, one in RestoredEntries and

prs.title: feat(gateway): add per-request logging to gateway with --request-logging
prs.truncated_body:
Logs POST bodies too, so probably not ideal for environments where performance is critical, or where you think there might be data leakage (although the gateway is intended for non-sensitive traffic).

This was just a private branch feature but I found it super useful for debugging and decided there's a good chance I'm going to want this again. I also tried logging to stdout, but having it inter

commits.message:
feat(gateway): add per-request logging to gateway with --request-logging

Logs POST bodies too, so probably not ideal for environments where performance
is critical, or where you think there might be data leakage (although the
gateway is intended for non-sensitive traffic).
